plugin:
k
the damping ratio is c/(2*sqrt(k)). if this ratio is: = 0 : oscillates forever < 1 : oscillates with decreasing amplitude = 1 : reaches the target precisely and quickly (no oscillation) > 1 : reaches the target slowly the higher the value of k, the quicker the system will reach the target value
Type pertains to how you want the game engine to handle this object Certain flags applicable only to certain object types, should be self evident
These fields are only used for goal area objects with boundaries, and for respawn zones
These fields are used for default spawning times and remapping
These are respawn zone weights, used only for respawn zones
These fields are only used for defining certain, special markers to use for positional locations if the default position (object origin) is not sufficient
Effect played when an object of this type spawns in during each game mode. Unlike creation effect, it is only played when the object spawns in through certain methods, not whenever one is created.
/>
These will override the righthand/lefthand nodes when the weapon matches the one used by the unit
when the unit velocity is 0, the yaw/pitch rates are the left values at [max speed reference], the yaw/pitch rates are the right values. the max speed reference is what the code uses to generate a clamped speed from 0..1 the exponent controls how midrange speeds are interpreted. IOW: As velocity exceeds 'min speed' and approaches 'max speed', turn rates are scaled from low --> high

when the steering is off by more than the cusp angle the steering will overcompensate more and more. when it is less, it overcompensates less and less. the exponent should be something in the neighborhood of 2.0
